_header: Be glad lordings both more and less
_description: A Christmas carol — five quatrains (aaab) and Latin burden (cb): ‘Puer nobis natus est / De virgine Maria’

CULIi411.First Lines:
Lystenyt lordynges more and leesI bryng yow tydynd of
                    gladnesAs sabel beryt wytnes…
CULIi411.Last Lines: …Fro [the] fend thou kepe meTua prece pia
CULIi411.Note:
Added to originally blank verso of last folio in volume, with pentrials
                    and drawings.
CULIi411.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.203.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 25; 1977, 19-20.

BLHar5396.First Lines:
Be glad lordynges betheI bryng you tydynges of
                    gladnes…
BLHar5396.Last Lines:
…That bare a child witouten synKepe vs all fre hell
                        pynDe virgine maria
BLHar5396.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Specimens of Old Christmas Carols, etc.
Percy Society
         4. London: T. Richard, 1841: 33.
Chambers,  Edmund Kerchever,  and  Frank Sidgwick.  
             Early English Lyrics….
         London: Buller, 1907, 1911 et seq: 118.
Rickert,  Edith,
                        ed.  
             Ancient English Christmas Carols.
         London: Chatto & Windus, 1910: 22.

PROC4734112.First Lines:
lordyngs be glad botheI bryng you tydynges of grete
                    gladnesse…
PROC4734112.Last Lines:
…That he vs fro the fynde childeTua prece
                    pia
